title: Having only Thunderbird receive emails
creator: alan410
content: I bought a new computer and had to download Thunderbird again. I tried the most recent one, didn't like it, so randomly picked a previous release from 2023 (don't remember when I installed the previous one) and hoped for the best. In the past, I would keep some emails in my inbox and tend to them as needed and then keep or delete when I had done what was required. I would also need to go to my ISP email's page, to get spam email, because Thunderbird didn't provide me with those. When there, I would delete what was in the inbox, so I could easily keep letters there to a minimum. Now, however, when I delete something in my ISP's inbox, it deletes in my Thunderbird portal too. I can't find settings in my ISP's page to stop it from downloading automatically (so it won't duplicate what I've already received via Thunderbird), and I can't find any settings in Thunderbird, to ask it to keep what I have in my inbox, instead of deleting everything I delete with my ISP. Do I need to go further back and find an earlier release in order to be able to use Thunderbird as I used to do? Or can I tweak the one I have?

title: Emails with just frames instead of some pasted images
creator: perpetuum-mobile
content:
This bug shows up in Thunderbird 115.18.0 (64-Bit) on Xubuntu 22.04.5 LTS, but it might be present also in other versions.

When I am discussing software topics, I often write emails about what I did and what happened then. I document my findings with pasted screenshots. The emails are HTML-Type emails.

While I am composing these emails, everything looks perfectly ok.

But once the email is sent, it arrives at its destination without some of the pasted pictures and only with frames showing the sizes of those pictures! When I look op those emails under "sent", some of the later suppressed pictures miss from there. It looks like TB switches to a "loose pictures" mode once and sticks to it for that particular email. It looks like the probability of being hit by this bug increases with the number of pasted pictures.

Note: This complaint is different from this one https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1183434, where it is about pictures copied and pasted from the web (where it might be the case that instead of the picture an Internet link gets posted: My complaint is about pictures not related to any internet source but rather to pictures from my screenshooter utility, which is xfce4-screenshooter (I am on Linux, in particular on Xubuntu 20.04).

The first (usually 1 or 2) pictures arrive well at the destination of the email but if the number of pasted screenshots exceeds 4 or 5, the bug shows up. The really bad thing is that when I am composing the mail, everything looks perfectly ok. I can only tell if a mail is affected from this bug, when the email is sent - and then it is too late!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0

title: all emails come in already showing as "read"
creator: jfraze
content:
Just installed Thunderbird on a new Windows 11 computer. On this computer only, ALL my emails are marked as read. All the time. That is, they don't change from bold to light, they are always light, before I even touch anything at all. I have no way of knowing on this computer if I have new mail or un-read mail that I need to address.

I would expect the email to match the other computer, at least. That is, if I open the email(s) on another device, I would expect, and want, that email to show up as "read" on this device. But that isn't what's happening. Nothing is EVER marked as unread. If 20 new emails appear on the other device they are bold on that device, but on the Windows 11 computer they all show up marked read, as if they'd all been read somewhere, on some device. But they only show up that way on the Windows installation. On the Mac and on the iPhone they behave exactly as I'd expect, and as they always have in the past.

I'm about to just give up on using this computer for email at all. Is there any solution? (And please don't suggest I need to uncheck the "mark email as read" setting, since that clearly has nothing to do with the fact that emails which are unread and untouched at all, anywhere, show up as read from the moment they appear in the inbox. Anyway, I tried that on a lark, and it changed nothing!)
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0

title: Calendar events not showing up on Calendar unless Notify attendees is unchecked
creator: donaldb627
content:
When I create a calendar event, it will not show up in the calendar view (Month), even after trying several times. What I found is, it will only show up on the calendar if I uncheck the Notify Attendees box at the bottom, which is by default always checked. After I uncheck the Notify attendees box on an event, that event, and each successive event will then show up on the calendar, regardless if I have the Notify attendees box checked or unchecked. I looked to see if I can uncheck this box in Settings, but do not see where this can be done.

Is there a way to have the Notify attendees box unchecked by default when I create a new calendar event?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0

title: <SEND> & other buttons gone from top of window
creator: pnuts1
content:
Hi there. I am contacting on behalf of a friend (Although I am using Thunderbird myself). he has this problem where upon the top button selections of a few windows have disappeared and he is of course forced to use the drop down menus (Where applicable).

His version is 115.18.0. MAC OS High Sierra.

I tried the 'restore defaults' but nothing happened. When I tried to customise the windows to defaults - I could not 'see' the SEND option everything else was there.

So I tried to install the latest up from 115.18.0 (118.18.0) but this just sent me back to the start where upon I had to enter into account details - I just thought it would use the setup already there. I got a bit cautious on that one and stopped.

So he is back to 115.18.0 with no buttons at the top.

Any help is greatly appreciated indeed!.

Thanks in advance,

Pete.

title: "smtp.gmail.com port 465 with SSL/TLS security by OAuth2 rejected,"
creator: WindsurferLA
content:
Thunderbird has worked just fine to send messages from my Google Gmail account until today when suddenly, , it seems to reject sending of most eMail messages and does not save outgoing messages to the sent folder. When I seek to send a message, it says

smtp.gmail.com:465 .. the certificate is not trusted because it hasn't been verified as issued by a trusted authority using a secure signature

It also will no longer send mail from "smtp.gmail.com:465 for Yahool

All of a sudden I seem to have lost ability to send eMails.

I will be completely restarting my machine.

Suggestions?
